detail.content: Production Center: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Production Center  NYU boasts one of the largest filmmaking facilities on the Eastern Seaboard, serving the needs of both our Undergraduate and Graduate film and video students. The facility is run by 11 full-time staff members and over 50 technical assistants that are both technically and professionally trained in many technical and aesthetic aspects of film production, including: film planning and production, equipment operation, equipment maintenance and repair.    The Production Center supports every aspect of the well-over 4,500 student projects shot every year, with technical seminars, industry-professional equipment, film stock and supplies, equipment repair services, and additional support for planning and development of student films. The equipment packages vary by level of study (fundamental through advanced/thesis), and are available to students enrolled in production courses. the production center consists of 5 areas which include the Advanced and Fundamental Equipment Areas, Repair Shop, Equipment Reservations Office, and the Production Office, which provides the students with the supplies and resources needed to produce a film or video.  Production Coordinator Eric Juhola 721 Broadway 9th floor New York, NY 10003 Phone: (212) 998-1790           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Minor in Producing: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Minor in Producing   The Tisch School of the Arts is an ideal academic environment to train the creative producer as an artist. The producer finds the material, gathers the talent, oversees the fabrication of the work and steers it to the marketplace. It is the producer’s vision that marks him or her as an artist.    An interdisciplinary producer with a firm knowledge of the craft, a discerning eye for material, fundraising ability, a grasp of the law, cash-flow, people and ethics, is rare. The Producing Minor is a specialized track designed to provide students of any major with a framework for understanding the dynamics of producing as an art form and a business profession.    The producing minor curriculum consists of no less than 18 points.  Producing and Writing in Sydney counts towards the Minor in Producing.  Producing in London counts towards the Minor in Producing. Minor in Producing Curriculum: Required Courses (8 Points) Electives (9 Points)  Practical Experience Requirement   Back to Minors How to Apply for a Minor Writing & Producing in Florence Producing in London  Minor in Producing Curriculum (pdf)  Tisch Minors 721 Broadway, 12 Floor               Phone:       212.998.1500               Fax:       212 995 4578 tisch.minors@nyu.edu           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Facilities: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV > Facilities          Digital Media Library The library staff provides students with access to audition/rehearsal rooms, screening rooms and an extensive collection of screenplays. More Production Center The largest production center on the Eastern Seabord serves the needs of all of our film and video students. More Post Production Film, video and sound editing, audio mixing, film-to-tape transfers and interformat duplication are provided in the Post Production Area. More Animation Area The Animation Area serves the needs of students for both animation and live-action projects. More Todman Center The Todman Center for Film and Television located at 35 West 4th Street More Teaching Soundstage The Teaching Soundstage serves as a location for both graduate and undergraduate classes. More 12th Floor TV Studios (TV12) Live television productions are an everyday occurrence in our Television Studios. More   Self Guided Walking Tour: Film & TV  Maurice Kanbar Institute of Film & Television 721 Broadway New York, NY 10003          Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
